description:
Hey,

I am running Xubuntu 12.04.2 and I installed OpenStack Grizzly through Ubuntu Cloud Archive.

I want to use the preallocate_images=space option to preallocate my qcow2 file.
But it throws that error and the file "disk" in the associated instance dir isn't preallocated.

here the /var/log/nova/nova-compute.log:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/42851/

nova.conf:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/42852/

many thanks...

[update:] concerns raw too.
(with nova.conf options:
libvirt_images_type=raw
force_raw_images=True
use_cow_images=False
preallocate_images=space
)
title: Unable to preallocate_images=space

comments.content:
Hey,

It isn't a bug. I have used ext3 and that was wrong. 
But it seems so...because the error message has not enough information to find a real good solution for the problem.
I mean when you get the message " Unable to preallocate_images=space at path:", you really know that it was unable to 
preallocate. What you don't know, is that you have the wrong file system and you don't know that fallocate(1) is used.
So the error message could be change to a more information-rich message.

only I you checked the comment in the source you get it:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py

thx for the attention
